section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (E) Musical works database .-
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (E) Musical works database .-?
answer: { "q": "What information must be included in the musical works database regarding a matched musical work?", "a": "The title of the musical work, the copyright owner of the work (or share thereof), and the ownership percentage of that owner, as well as contact information for such copyright owner. Additionally, to the extent reasonably available, the

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > Chapter 1 · Notes
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > Chapter 1 · Notes?
answer: { "q": "When was section 117 of the copyright law amended in its entirety?", "a": "In 1980." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 114 · Scope of exclusive rights in sound recordings 48
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 114 · Scope of exclusive rights in sound recordings 48?
answer: { "q": "What rights does the owner of a copyright in a sound recording have?", "a": "The exclusive rights of the owner of copyright in a sound recording are limited to the rights specified by clauses (1), (2), (3) and (6) of section 106, and do not include any right of performance under section 106(4). [p. 67]" }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1506 · Conduct of proceedings
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1506 · Conduct of proceedings?
answer: { "q": "What law governs the proceedings of the Copyright Claims Board?", "a": "This chapter and regulations established by the Register of Copyrights under this chapter, in addition to relevant principles of law under this title." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 111 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Secondary transmissions of broadcast programming by cable 44
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 111 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Secondary transmissions of broadcast programming by cable 44?
answer: { "q": "What is an example of a secondary transmission that is exempted from copyright infringement?", "a": "A hotel relaying broadcast signals to its guests' private lodgings within the local service area of the station, without making a direct charge." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 512 · Limitations on liability relating to material online 11
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 512 · Limitations on liability relating to material online 11?
answer: { "q": "What type of communications are exempt from liability under § 512?", "a": "Transitory Digital Network Communications" }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1401 · Unauthorized use of pre-1972 sound recordings
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1401 · Unauthorized use of pre-1972 sound recordings?
answer: { "q": "What is the term of prohibition for unauthorized acts regarding pre-1972 sound recordings?", "a": "The prohibition applies to a sound recording described in paragraph (1) through December 31 of the year that is 95 years after the year of first publication, and for a further transition period as prescribed under subparagraph (B)." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > Statutory Enactments Contained in Title 17 of the United States Code
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > Statutory Enactments Contained in Title 17 of the United States Code?
answer: { "q": "What is the purpose of the Copyright Act of 1976?", "a": "The purpose of the Copyright Act of 1976 is for the general revision of copyright law, Title 17 of the United States Code, and for other purposes.", "p": [10] }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 122 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Secondary transmissions of local television programming by satellite 65
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 122 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Secondary transmissions of local television programming by satellite 65?
answer: { "q": "What is considered a 'secondary transmission' under this section?", "a": "A secondary transmission of a performance or display of a work embodied in a primary transmission of a television broadcast station into the station's local market." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (1) Blanket license for digital uses. -
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (1) Blanket license for digital uses. -?
answer: { "q": "What types of reproductions are included in a blanket license?", "a": "Server, intermediate, archival, and incidental reproductions that are reasonable and necessary for the digital music provider to engage in covered activities." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Network stations .-
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Network stations .-?

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > §104A · Copyright in restored works 31
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > §104A · Copyright in restored works 31?
answer: { "q": "What happens automatically when a work is restored under this section?", "a": "Copyright subsists in the restored work and vests automatically on the date of restoration [p. 31]." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (c) Adjustment of Royalty Fees .-
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (c) Adjustment of Royalty Fees .-?
answer: { "q": "What is the applicable fee for determining the royalty fee under subsection (b)(1)(B)?", "a": "The appropriate fee set forth in part 258 of title 37, Code of Federal Regulations, as in effect on July 1, 2009, as modified under this paragraph." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 112 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Ephemeral recordings 46
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 112 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Ephemeral recordings 46?
answer: { "q": "What type of works are exempt from the limitations on exclusive rights in sound recordings?", "a": "Motion pictures and other audiovisual works [p. 63]" }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 304 · Duration of copyright: Subsisting copyrights 6
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 304 · Duration of copyright: Subsisting copyrights 6?
answer: { "q": "What is the duration of copyright for works subsisting on January 1, 1978?", "a": "28 years from the date it was originally secured [p. 189]" }

question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 110 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Exemption of certain performances and displays 43?
answer: { "q": "What type of educational institutions are exempt from copyright infringement for face-to-face teaching activities?", "a": "Nonprofit educational institutions" }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Limited temporary waiver .-
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Limited temporary waiver .-?
answer: { "q": "What triggers a temporary waiver of an injunction against a satellite carrier?", "a": "A request made by the satellite carrier, specifically if they were not providing local service to certain areas as of December 31, 2009 [p. 24–156]." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > §101 · Definitions 2
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > §101 · Definitions 2?
answer: { "q": "What is an anonymous work?", "a": "An anonymous work is a work on the copies or phonorecords of which no natural person is identified as author." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1201 · Circumvention of copyright protection systems 2
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1201 · Circumvention of copyright protection systems 2?
answer: { "q": "What is prohibited regarding circumvention of technological measures?", "a": "No person shall circumvent a technological measure that effectively controls access to a work protected under this title." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 115 · Scope of exclusive rights in nondramatic musical works: Compulsory license for making and distributing phonorecords 50
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 115 · Scope of exclusive rights in nondramatic musical works: Compulsory license for making and distributing phonorecords 50?
answer: { "q": "What is the primary purpose required to obtain a compulsory license to make phonorecords of a nondramatic musical work?", "a": "The primary purpose must be to distribute them to the public for private use." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > Sec. 404 · Annual Reports.
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > Sec. 404 · Annual Reports.?
answer: { "q": "What is the deadline for submitting the initial report under Sec. 404?", "a": "The initial report required under this subsection shall be submitted by May 1, 2009." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 801 · Copyright Royalty Judges; appointment and functions 2
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 801 · Copyright Royalty Judges; appointment and functions 2?
answer: { "q": "Who appoints the Copyright Royalty Judges?", "a": "The Librarian of Congress appoints the Copyright Royalty Judges after consultation with the Register of Copyrights." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (3) Voluntary negotiation period .-
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (3) Voluntary negotiation period .-?
answer: { "q": "What is the purpose of the voluntary negotiation period initiated by the Copyright Royalty Judges?", "a": "The purpose of the voluntary negotiation period is to allow participants in the proceeding to negotiate among themselves before further proceedings are taken. [p. 268]" }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 804 · Institution of proceedings 7
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 804 · Institution of proceedings 7?
answer: { "q": "Who can file a petition for determining or adjusting royalty rates?", "a": "Any owner or user of a copyrighted work whose royalty rates are specified by this title, or are established under this chapter before or after the enactment of the Copyright Royalty and Distribution Reform Act of 2004." }

question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > Appendix N · Notes?
answer: { "q": "What year was section 2318 of Title 18 of the United States Code added?", "a": "1962" }

answer: { "q": "What are the objectives of the Joint Strategic Plan against counterfeiting and infringement?", "a": "The objectives of the Joint Strategic Plan are to reduce counterfeit and infringing goods in the domestic and international supply chain, and to identify and address structural weaknesses or other impediments to effective enforcement action against

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (e) Compensation. -
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (e) Compensation. -?
answer: { "q": "What is the compensation rate for the Chief Copyright Royalty Judge?", "a": "The Chief Copyright Royalty Judge receives compensation at the rate of basic pay payable for level AL-1 for administrative law judges pursuant to section 5372(b) of title 5." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Additional terms and conditions. -
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Additional terms and conditions. -?
answer: { "q": "What is the effect of voluntary license agreements on copyright owners?", "a": "Voluntary license agreements negotiated between copyright owners of nondramatic musical works and persons entitled to obtain a compulsory license under subsection (a) shall be given effect in lieu of any determination by the Copyright Royalty Judges." }

question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 108 · Limitations on exclusive rights: Reproduction by libraries and archives 41?

Additionally, the reproduction must include a notice of

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 2318 · Trafficking in counterfeit labels, illicit labels, or counterfeit documentation or packaging 1
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 2318 · Trafficking in counterfeit labels, illicit labels, or counterfeit documentation or packaging 1?
answer: { "q": "What does 'counterfeit label' mean in the context of § 2318?", "a": "An identifying label or container that appears to be genuine but is not." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > Chapter 4 · Notes
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > Chapter 4 · Notes?
answer: { "q": "What was the effect of the Prioritizing Resources and Organization for Intellectual Property Act of 2008 on section 411?", "a": "The Prioritizing Resources and Organization for Intellectual Property Act of 2008 amended the title for section 411 by adding 'civil' to it, so that the new title is 'Registration and civil infringement actions.' [p. 216]"

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (b) Statute of Limitations. -
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (b) Statute of Limitations. -?
answer: { "q": "What is the statute of limitations for commencing a proceeding before the Copyright Claims Board?", "a": "A proceeding may not be maintained unless commenced within 3 years after the claim accrued [p. 363]." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 118 · Scope of exclusive rights: Use of certain works in connection with noncommercial broadcasting 55
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 118 · Scope of exclusive rights: Use of certain works in connection with noncommercial broadcasting 55?
answer: { "q": "What types of works are exempt from exclusive rights under section 118?", "a": "Published nondramatic musical works and published pictorial, graphic, and sculptural works [p. 136]." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > 1. See note 8, infra .
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > 1. See note 8, infra .?

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 203 · Termination of transfers and licenses granted by the author 3
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 203 · Termination of transfers and licenses granted by the author 3?
answer: { "q": "Who can terminate a grant executed by two or more authors?", "a": "A majority of the authors who executed it; if any of such authors is dead, the termination interest of any such author may be exercised as a unit by the person or persons who own and are entitled to exercise a total of more than one-half of that author's interest." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Rehearings .-
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > (2) Rehearings .-?
answer: { "q": "What is the condition under which the Copyright Royalty Judges may order a rehearing?", "a": "The Copyright Royalty Judges may order a rehearing upon motion of a participant in a proceeding, after the determination in the proceeding is issued, on matters as they determine to be appropriate. [p. 272]" }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > Chapter 3 · Notes
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > Chapter 3 · Notes?
answer: { "q": "What is the term for which copyright is granted to the trustees under Mary Baker Eddy's will?", "a": "Seventy-five years from the effective date of this Act or from the date of first publication, whichever is later." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1001 · Definitions
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 1001 · Definitions?
answer: { "q": "What is a digital audio copied recording?", "a": "A reproduction in a digital recording format of a digital musical recording, whether made directly from another digital musical recording or indirectly from a transmission." }

section: Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 408 · Copyright registration in general 9
question: What is the main rule in Copyright Law United States Copyri > § 408 · Copyright registration in general 9?
answer: { "q": "What is required for copyright registration in a published work?", "a": "Two complete copies or phonorecords of the best edition must be deposited." }
